title: Reflection on the Use of GenAI
text:
For this assessment, I used ChatGPT, a generative AI (GenAI) tool developed by OpenAI. I chose ChatGPT because it is versatile, easy to interact with, and capable of providing explanations, code examples, and guidance across multiple subjects.




GenAI assisted me in completing this assessment in several ways:

Clarifying Concepts

For example, when I was unsure about rendering a Quarto website or handling GitHub Pages deployment, ChatGPT provided step-by-step instructions with clear explanations.

Writing and Editing Code

ChatGPT helped me write CSS for a warm retro theme, Quarto .qmd pages, and R code snippets, saving me time and reducing syntax errors.

Organizing Thoughts

It suggested ways to structure my website content, including sections for projects, skills, and personal introduction, making the final site more cohesive.







Time-saving: Tasks that might take hours to research and figure out were explained quickly.

Accessibility: I could ask questions anytime without needing a human tutor.

Learning Aid: It provided examples that helped me understand concepts more deeply, like how Quarto renders .qmd files into HTML.






Context limitations: Sometimes ChatGPT misunderstood the specific folder structure of my project or gave general answers that required adjustment.

Over-reliance risk: While the tool gives helpful answers, I still needed to verify and adapt them, especially for code that interacts with Git or GitHub Pages.

Lack of human judgment: It doesnâ€™t always know which design choices are best aesthetically â€” it canâ€™t replace personal creativity.





I think GenAI tools will continue to assist me in:

Learning new programming concepts quickly

Drafting content and documentation for projects

Debugging code efficiently

Brainstorming ideas for websites, reports, or creative projects

I see GenAI as a partner in learning and productivity, not a replacement for my own effort or critical thinking.




Using GenAI has been a positive experience for this assessment. It encourages me to think more critically, ask better questions, and explore solutions efficiently. I anticipate that such tools will be invaluable in both my future studies and professional work, as long as I maintain an active role in reviewing and applying the guidance responsibly.

title: About Me
text:
This page shares a few experiences that reflect my learning journey and hobbies.



I take structured learning notes to reinforce what I study. For example:

R, Python / Tableau & Data Analysis: Notes on data wrangling, visualization, and modeling help me revisit concepts quickly during projects.

Quarto & Web Development: Step-by-step guides I created while learning website deployment and Git workflow are invaluable for reference.

Keeping notes helps me apply knowledge practically, whether in coding projects or academic work.




Outside of academics, I enjoy:

Traveling: Experiencing Malaysia and Thailand, trying new cuisines, and finding inspiration in new environments.

Movies & Music: Watching anime from various genres and discovering new soundtracks.

These hobbies keep me creative and balanced, often inspiring problem-solving and project ideas.

title: Ming Jun's Portfolio
text:
Students who study more hours generally achieve a higher Performance Index, showing a positive correlation.
Previous scores also influence performance - students with higher prior scores tend to cluster at higher Performance Index values.
Sleep hours affect performance subtly; students with very low or very high sleep tend to deviate slightly from the trend, suggesting balanced rest may help performance.

title: My Projects
text:
Hereâ€™s a selection of some of the key projects Iâ€™ve worked on during my studies. Each showcases my skills in web development, databases, and cloud computing.




Description:
Developed a dynamic web application using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and backend technologies. The project demonstrates responsive design, user authentication, and integration with APIs.
Highlights:
- Implemented a RESTful API to fetch and display data dynamically.
- Designed responsive UI that adapts to mobile and desktop screens.
- Learned full-stack development workflow including version control with Git and deployment.
Screenshot / Demo:







Description:
Built a relational database system to manage and query complex datasets efficiently. Focused on data modeling, SQL queries, and database normalization.
Highlights:
- Designed ER diagrams and implemented relational schema in MySQL/MariaDB.
- Created stored procedures and triggers to automate tasks.
- Optimized queries for performance and reliability.
Screenshot / Diagram:







Description:
Implemented a cloud-based solution using virtual machines, containerization, and cloud storage. The project emphasizes scalability, security, and deployment automation.
Highlights:
- Deployed applications on cloud platforms (AWS/Azure/GCP).
- Used Docker containers to ensure reproducibility and easy scaling.
- Configured continuous deployment pipelines to streamline updates.
Screenshot / Architecture Diagram:

title: Ming Jun's Portfolio
section: 2. No.of Sample papers vs Performance Index
text:
2. No.of Sample papers vs Performance Index









Students who practice more sample question papers achieve higher average Performance Index, showing active preparation pays off.
The improvement is more noticeable when moving from 1-2 papers to 3-4 papers, suggesting a threshold effect where consistent practice significantly boosts performance.
Helps educators identify that encouraging practice with sample papers can be an effective strategy to improve overall student outcomes.
